intro: Pseudogynoxys fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant false yew, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, yellowish flowers that are typically arranged in inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
